comments: Previous name was: A simple grammar.Categorize your books by the branch of mathematics that they concern (there may be any number of these).  Within each category separate the books you understand from the ones that you don't (there must be at least one book you understand and one that you don't). Linearly order both separations of books in every category. - _Geoffrey Critzer_, Dec 11 2011
links: INRIA Algorithms Project, Encyclopedia of Combinatorial Structures 860
mathematica: nn = 20; a = x/(1 - x); Range[0, nn]! CoefficientList[Series[Exp[ a^2], {x, 0, nn}], x] (* _Geoffrey Critzer_, Dec 11 2011 *)
prog: (Maxima) makelist(if n=0 then 1 else sum(n!/k!*binomial(n-1, 2*k-1), k, 0, floor(n/2)), n, 0, 18); [Bruno Berselli, May 25 2011](PARI)N=33;  x='x+O('x^N);egf=exp(x^2/(1-x)^2);Vec(serlaplace(egf))/* _Joerg Arndt_, Sep 15 2012 */
author: encyclopedia(AT)pommard.inria.fr, Jan 25 2000
extensions: New name using e.g.f., _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Oct 01 2013
